name: places/ChIJ2aNEECX2wokRr8FexExpMD8
formattedAddress: Midtown Manhattan, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: Midtown Manhattan, New York, NY 10036, USA

originalText.text:
I am writing this review to express my deep concerns about the professional conduct and ethics of Dr. Stepan, the couples therapist with whom I had sessions. It is with great disappointment that I feel compelled to bring attention to the issues I encountered during our therapeutic engagement.

Throughout our sessions, I observed a troubling pattern in which Dr. Stepan appeared to prioritize the interests of my former partner over providing unbiased and equitable treatment to both parties involved. This bias was evident in Dr. Stepan's dismissive attitude towards the racial prejudice and obstacles I faced, as well as the premature diagnosis of depression without a thorough exploration of the contextual factors influencing my emotional well-being.

What is particularly concerning is the discovery of a potential monetary incentive that may have influenced Dr. Stepan's actions. It has come to my attention that my former partner, the individual I sought therapy with, was paying Dr. Stepan out-of-pocket for her services. This raises serious questions about the impartiality and integrity of the therapeutic process, as financial arrangements between therapist and client can introduce conflicts of interest that compromise the quality of care.

As clients, we trust therapists to act in our best interests, adhering to professional ethics and maintaining a fair and unbiased therapeutic environment. Unfortunately, it appears that these fundamental principles were compromised in my experience with Dr. Stepan.

I encourage individuals considering therapy to carefully evaluate the potential conflicts of interest that may arise from financial arrangements between therapist and client. Transparency and accountability are essential in maintaining trust and ensuring the effectiveness of the therapeutic process.

It is my hope that Dr. Stepan reflects upon these concerns and takes the necessary steps to reevaluate her professional practices. By doing so, she can work towards providing an ethical, unbiased, and supportive therapeutic experience to her clients.
